command: tcpdump -i eth0 -n "tcp[tcpflags] & tcp-syn != 0 and dst port 54321" -c 3 >/dev/null && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 2222 -j ACCEPT
explanation: Waits for three TCP SYNs to a decoy port (54321) and then opens TCP/2222 via iptables, using network traffic as the activation signal. Requires root for tcpdump on some interfaces and for iptables. Detection: alert on repeated SYNs to an unused high port and immediate firewall changes.
rationale_steps: Attach tcpdump with a filter for SYNs targeting TCP/54321.
Count exactly three hits, suggesting a knock pattern.
Upon threshold, insert rule to expose TCP/2222.
Uses passive signaling without an always-open control port.
Detection: monitor for abnormal SYNs to non-listening ports; log and alert on iptables -I insertions.
